subject: College Athletics
Basketball
Coaches and Managers
lead_paragraph: Mark Gottfried resigned as Alabama’s basketball coach Monday, leaving in the middle of his 11th season amid criticism of the team’s play and the departure of a star player. He will be replaced by the assistant Philip Pearson. Alabama is 12-7. Gottfried’s teams have missed the N.C.A.A. tournament the last two years, and he was criticized over the recent departure of point guard Ronald Steele. The university said Steele departed because of an injury, but Steele said there was more to his decision.
